title: AI-assisted coding for teams that can't get away with vibes
description: Simon Willison analyzes Atharva Raykar's insights on professional AI-assisted development. Building with AI is fast but requires good test coverage, linting, and CI/CD. AI is a multiplier of expertise, and tests are non-negotiable for professional development teams that cannot rely on 'vibe coding' practices.
author: Simon Willison

title: Software 3.0: Andrej Karpathy on AI's Impact on Programming
description: Andrej Karpathy discusses 'Software 3.0' - the paradigm where neural networks became programmable with large language models. He shares experiences with 'vibe coding' and the reality of building web apps with AI assistance, emphasizing the need to design workflows that leverage AI strengths while mitigating weaknesses.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: The BEST AI Coding Assistants | June 2025
description: Comprehensive review of top AI coding tools and assistants for June 2025. Covers leading platforms including GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Claude Code, and emerging tools. Analyzes features, pricing, and performance across different coding scenarios and development workflows.
author: Tech Review Community

title: Delegating Software Engineering to LLMs, June 2025
description: Complete workflow guide for integrating asynchronous AI agents into software development processes. Demonstrates practical approaches for delegating engineering tasks to LLMs while maintaining quality control and project management standards.
author: AI Engineering Community

title: Understanding Developer Practices in LLM-Assisted Software Development
description: CMU research paper examining how developers integrate AI into software development processes. Analyzes real-world practices, challenges, and success factors for teams adopting LLM-assisted coding tools in professional environments.
author: CMU Research Team

title: AI Agentic Programming: A Survey of Techniques, Challenges, and Applications
description: Comprehensive survey covering new programming paradigms where LLM-based agents autonomously perform software development tasks. Analyzes current techniques, remaining challenges, and practical applications in the emerging field of agentic programming.
author: Research Community

title: Best LLMs for Coding â€“ June 2025
description: Technical analysis and benchmarking of top language models for coding tasks. Evaluates performance across different programming languages, complexity levels, and real-world development scenarios. Includes recommendations for different use cases and project requirements.
author: FlowHunt Technical Team

title: The Best AI Coding Tools, Workflows & LLMs for June 2025
description: Comprehensive analysis of current AI coding landscape, covering top tools, effective workflows, and best LLM choices for different development scenarios. Provides practical guidance for developers and teams looking to optimize their AI-assisted coding processes.
author: Sean Murray
